intro: Thelypteris medogensis, commonly known as the Medog holly fern, is a rare and endemic fern species native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Dryopteridaceae and is characterized by its delicate, lace-like fronds with a distinctive, finely divided structure. The plant thrives in cool, humid environments, typically found in shaded forest understories at high elevations. Its spores are released from small, clustered structures called sori located on the underside of its fronds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Thelypteris medogensis is considered a vulnerable species, highlighting the importance of conservation efforts in its native range.
